transcribedText: What I want to do today, since this is Build as a Startup School, is share with you some lessons I've learned about building startups at AI Fund. AI Fund is a venture studio, and we build an average of about one startup per month. And because we co-found the startups, we're in there writing code, talking to customers, designing our features, determining pricing. And so we've done a lot of reps of not just watching others build startups, but actually being in the weeds, building startups with entrepreneurs. And what I want to do today is share with you some of the lessons I've learned building startups, especially around this changing AI technology and what it enables. And we focus on the theme of speed. So it turns out that for those of you that want to build a startup, I think a strong predictor for startups' odds of success is execution speed. And I have a lot of respect for the entrepreneurs and executives that can just do things really quickly. And new AI technology is enabling startups to go much faster. So what I hope to do is share with you some of those best practices, which are frankly changing every two to three months still, to let you get that speed that hopefully lets you have a higher odds of success. Before diving into speed, a lot of people ask me, hey, Andrew, where are the opportunities for startups? So this is what I think of as an AI stack, where at the lowest level are the semiconductor companies, then the clouds are hyperscalers built on top of that, a lot of the AI foundation model companies built on top of that, and even though a lot of PR excitement and hype has been on these technology layers, it turns out that almost by definition, the biggest opportunities have to be at the application layer, because we actually need the applications to generate even more revenue so that they can afford to pay the foundation, cloud and semiconductor technology layers. So for whatever reason, media and social media tends not to talk about the application layer as much. But for those of you thinking of building startups, almost by definition, the biggest opportunities have to be there, although of course, the opportunities are all layers of the stack. One of the things that's changed a lot over the last year, and in terms of AI tech trends, if you ask me what's the most important tech trend in AI, I would say is the rise of agentic AI. And about a year and a half ago, when I started to go around and give talks to try to convince people that AI agents might be a thing, I did not realize that around last summer, a bunch of marketers would get a hold of this term and use it as a sticker and slap it on everything in sight, which made it almost lose some of its meaning. But I want to share with you from a technical perspective, why I think agentic AI is exciting and important and also opens up a lot more startup opportunities. So it turns out that the way a lot of us use OMs is to prompt it, to have it generate output. And the way we have an OOM output something is as if you're going to a human or in this case an AI and asking it to please type out an essay for you by writing from the first word to the last word.

slides.title: Introduction to Building Startups
slides.content: Introduction to the lessons learned at AI Fund, a venture studio dedicated to building startups. Focus on insights from practical experiences in startup co-founding.
slides.speakerNotes: Welcome everyone to the Startup School session. Today, I will be sharing valuable lessons I've learned from building startups at AI Fund, where we co-found and actively participate in startup development.

slides.title: The Importance of Speed in Startups
slides.content: Execution speed is a critical indicator of startup success. New AI technologies facilitate increased speed and efficiency, providing a competitive edge.
slides.speakerNotes: One of the key insights I've gained is the critical role of speed in startup success. We'll discuss how AI technology accelerates startup processes and enhances execution speed.

slides.title: Identifying Startup Opportunities
slides.content: Overview of the AI stack from semiconductors to application layers. Emphasis on the application layer as the largest opportunity space in AI startups.
slides.speakerNotes: Let's discuss the AI stack and the abundance of opportunities it presents, with a particular focus on the often-overlooked application layer, where significant revenue potential lies.

slides.title: The Evolution of AI Technology
slides.content: Exploration of the emerging trend of agentic AI and its impact on creating startup opportunities.
slides.speakerNotes: One of the most exciting AI trends is agentic AI. I will explain its significance and how it leads to new possibilities in the startup ecosystem.

slides.title: Agentic AI: A Technical Perspective
slides.content: Explanation of agentic AI and its function: generating outputs by simulating human-like task accomplishment.
slides.speakerNotes: Dive deeper into agentic AI, exploring its technical aspects and how it is utilized to perform tasks similarly to how a human would.

slides.title: Conclusion and Future Outlook
slides.content: Recap of lessons on startup speed and AI opportunities. Encouragement for leveraging AI advancements for startup success.
slides.speakerNotes: To conclude, I encourage all of you to leverage the rapid advancements in AI to fuel your startup endeavors and capitalize on the application layer's potential.
